doc.field:
This dataset depicts the planned alignments of future transitways which are in advanced design or under construction. Currently, this file includes alignments for Central Corridor LRT (Green Line), Southwest LRT (Green Line Extension), Cedar Avenue BRT (Red Line), I-35W BRT (Orange Line) and other planned BRT alignemnts. This file is markedly different from the Transitways2030 file which depicts all potential transitways in the Twin Cities Metro Area. (See http://datafinder.org/metadata/Transitways2030.htm) This file can be used at a large scale; however, these alignments are not a guarantee of actual completed alignment. File is for planning purposes only. Alignment is subject to change without warning. When transitway construction is completed and service begins, the alignment will move from this file to TransitwayAlignment (existing).
Additional Notes: - Green, Red and Orange line alignments are managed by Rachel Wiken (see Section 7). All other alignments are managed by:
Katie Roth Senior Planner Metro Transit BRT/Small Starts Project Office 707 16th Avenue S Minneapolis, MN 55454 612-349-7772 katie.roth@metrotransit.org

This file is markedly different from the Transitways2030 file which depicts all potential transitways in the Twin Cities Metro Area. (See http://datafinder.org/metadata/Transitways2030.htm) This file can be used at a large scale; however, these alignments are not a guarantee of actual completed alignment. File is for planning purposes only. Alignment is subject to change without warning. When transitway construction is completed and service begins, the alignment will move from this file to TransitwayAlignment (existing).
Additional Notes: - Green, Red and Orange line alignments are managed by Rachel Wiken (see Section 7). All other alignments are managed by:

- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/.
